poem:
**Headlines and Footnotes**

The ink dries from morning's dark fold,
A chorus, silent yet bold, whispers:
A win for women, a ripple in time.
The names we know, and those we don't,
A breath held for justice, exhale,
A tremor in the ticker tape,
while the sun lifts another day.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs charges are ‘a win for women’ says ex-Danity Kane member A former member of Sean Combs’s Danity Kane girl group says the federal sex-trafficking charges filed against the disgraced music mogul are “a win for women all over the world”. The singer Aubrey O’Day is not among several women who filed civil claims against Combs alleging rape and other physical violence before an indictment unsealed on Tuesday charged him in graphic terms". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs charges are ‘a win for women’ says ex-Danity Kane member A former member of Sean Combs’s Danity Kane girl group says the federal sex-trafficking charges filed against the disgraced music mogul are “a win for women all over the world”. The singer Aubrey O’Day is not among several women who filed civil claims against Combs alleging rape and other physical violence before an indictment unsealed on Tuesday charged him in graphic terms
